> > >  Interesting, but there's a few misconceptions about my work. I 
used 
> > > quartz crytals, not as part of any circuits or for frequency, 
some of 
> > > the "contacts" request the crystals, so I place them on, or in 
sound 
> > > chamber, it seems to help with some entities, as do magents 
used in 
> > > the same way. There's no way to conect them to the circuit.
> > > 
> > >  I used radio modules from car stereos because they were 
already 
> > > designed to be volatage tuned, so I could use the random 
voltage 
> > > generator to tune these moudules randomly. Following EVPmaker 
as an 
> > > example, I had thought the tuning had to be random, as I 
thought 
> > > there was somekind of quantum resonance going on to get the 
voices. 
> > > That assumption has proved to be false, a linear scan is far 
superior 
> > > to random scan. I don't care what the "primary tester" claims, 
he 
> > > doesn't make the things. I still don't know how the voices are 
made. 
> > > 
> > >  We've also found anyone can do the same thing as a box by 
manually 
> > > tuning a radio across it's band slowly by hand while recording. 
It's 
> > > easier to have the precess automated, but the manual method is 
good 
> > > for quickie messages and guidence when needed. You wouldn't 
want to 
> > > get hooked on doing sessions to ask about every little thing in 
your 
> > > life though. 
> > > 
> > >  Personally, I don't have all these higher ideals, asperations, 
or 
> > > goals as some seem to claim in the paranormal field. I don't 
insist 
> > > only the higher beings coming through with only the blessing of 
some 
> > > deity--I don't care what talks. I get some cussing and name 
calling --
> > > sometimes, but big deal! It does in fact show it's not 
broadcast 
> > > fragments. As for portals some claim opened--I don't even know 
what 
> > > they are talking about, I have never experienced a portal--or 
> > > anything that might be considered evil--except perhaps some of 
the 
> > > living. I can't imagine box use being anymore dangerous than 
watching 
> > > to much TV, and taking every show as gospel truth. Wonder how 
many 
> > > live their lives by what's on Friends, or Saturday Night Live!? 
90% 
> > > or more of what I get is just my familar guys, my unseen 
friends, 
> > > talking, mostly very non-profound comments. I get some 
relatives, my 
> > > son, and dad, maybe an uncle from time to time, I don't take it 
like 
> > > it's all profound and mystical, it's just communcations--ya 
don't 
> > > have to worship it, and you don't need some guru to interpret 
it! I 
> > > don't know how many can hear this stuff rihgt away, it might 
take 
> > > practice, since the voices are composites of various voices and 
music 
> > > bits mixed with radio noise. 
> > >  The function of the box is to provide the "raw" audio 
which "they" 
> > > use to form a voice. It is not the only way, there are many 
method 
> > > that work as well, and at times better. 
> > > 
> > >  As far as antenna, I just use a piece of wire and an Rf 
amplifier, I 
> > > don't care about resonating for each frquency, that would be 
very 
> > > cumbersome, and useless. Imagine a car with 10,000 antennas 
sticking 
> > > out it! Even on ham radio I have one 100 foot long dipole I use 
on 
> > > all hf bands, and talk all over the world on less than 5 watts. 
Of 
> > > course I use an antenna tuner to resonate it for the band I'm 
on. I 
> > > also haven't been on the air since starting EVP, it eats all my 
time!
> > > 
> > >  It's only the audio that I consider important, radio is a 
convenient 
> > > source of a mix of speech, music and noise that can be chopped 
up 
> > > easily by tuning. There is a program that does this on the 
computer, 
> > > called EVPmaker, and my boxes were an analog version of 
EVPmaker. I 
> > > am still curious why some spirits seems unable to use the 
computer 
> > > method, which lead to my boxes by asking waht else could I use?
